files.summary: Simple data transfer object representing a duty hours activity category with ID and name properties.
files.businessPurpose: Holds activity category metadata used to classify duty hour activities (e.g., clinical, on-call, educational) within a department's duty hour tracking configuration.
files.migrationNote: Simple DTO; equivalent type would be a TypeScript interface or MikroORM entity property in the Node.js backend.

files.summary: Data transfer object for duty hour activities, containing properties for activity details (name, abbreviation, category, department, QR code settings, disable/delete flags) and a Validate method for form validation.
files.businessPurpose: Represents a department-specific duty hour activity (e.g., 'Night Float', 'Clinic') with all configuration fields needed for CRUD operations and validation before saving to the database.
keyMethods: Validate - Validates required fields (ActivityName, Abbreviation) and checks for duplicates based on page mode
files.migrationNote: DTO with validation logic; would map to a NestJS DTO with class-validator decorators in the Node.js backend.

files.summary: Business manager for duty hour activities providing CRUD operations, category management, QR code functionality, and department-specific activity configuration. All methods are static and call stored procedures via CustomCommand/DBDataAccess.
files.businessPurpose: Central manager for managing department activities used in duty hour tracking. Handles listing, adding, updating, deleting, disabling, and restoring activities. Also manages activity categories, QR code scanning for attendance, and UCONN department lookups.
keyMethods: GetEnabledDepartmentActivities - Returns enabled activities for the logged-in user's department
GetDepartmentActivitiesByCategory - Fetches activities filtered by category with pagination support
Save - Creates a new department activity with validation and duplicate checking
Update - Updates an existing department activity
Delete - Soft-deletes a department activity
SetActivityDisableFlag - Toggles the enabled/disabled state of an activity
GetQRCodeDetailsforActivity - Retrieves QR code configuration for activity-based check-in
ReadQRforUsers - Processes QR code scan to save hours for activities
GetActivityCategorySettings - Returns configuration for all activity categories
files.migrationNote: Core duty hours activity management. Activity CRUD and category settings need equivalent NestJS service methods. QR code scanning is a unique feature that may need mobile API support in the Node.js backend.

files.summary: Data transfer object for duty hours administrator information, including user ID, name, email, department details, and a non-submitters notification flag.
files.businessPurpose: Represents a duty hours admin user who oversees trainee duty hour submissions for a department, with settings for receiving non-submitter notifications.
files.migrationNote: Simple DTO; would be a TypeScript interface in the Node.js backend.

files.summary: Business manager for duty hours administrator CRUD operations, including listing, adding, deleting DH admins, and managing non-submitter notification settings per department.
files.businessPurpose: Manages the assignment of administrators to duty hours oversight roles within departments. Admins receive notifications about trainees who have not submitted their hours and can manage duty hour compliance.
keyMethods: GetSuperVisors - Returns duty hours admins for the logged-in user's department
GetDHAdmins - Returns DH admins filtered by criteria
Save - Saves a list of DH admin assignments for a department
Delete - Removes a DH admin assignment
Update - Updates a DH admin's non-submitter notification status
files.migrationNote: DH admin management would be part of user role/permission management in the Node.js backend RBAC system.

files.summary: Data transfer object for Amion (on-call scheduling system) call service data, mapping external Amion entries to MyEvaluations activities.
files.businessPurpose: Holds Amion call service sync data including unique IDs, backup IDs, and new/deleted/selected flags used during the Amion-to-MyEvaluations synchronization process.
files.migrationNote: Part of the on-call schedule integration system. Amion/QGenda integrations may need API-based sync in the Node.js backend.

files.summary: Data transfer object for Amion clinic synchronization data, mapping external Amion clinic entries to MyEvaluations department clinics.
files.businessPurpose: Holds Amion clinic mapping data used during synchronization of clinic schedules from the Amion on-call scheduling system to MyEvaluations.
files.migrationNote: Part of the Amion schedule integration; equivalent sync would be handled by a NestJS integration service.

files.summary: Data transfer object for Amion rotation synchronization data, including duplicate rotation name detection and mapping properties.
files.businessPurpose: Holds rotation mapping data from the Amion on-call scheduling system, used to match external rotation records to MyEvaluations department rotations during sync.
files.migrationNote: Part of the Amion schedule integration. Rotation mappings need equivalent sync logic in Node.js.

files.summary: Data transfer object for Amion user synchronization data, mapping external Amion users to MyEvaluations users during schedule integration.
files.businessPurpose: Holds user mapping data from the Amion scheduling system, including staff type unique IDs, used to match Amion staff to MyEvaluations user accounts.
files.migrationNote: Part of the Amion user sync integration. User matching logic needs equivalent service in Node.js.

files.summary: Data transfer object for rotation block/period configuration, containing block number, start/end dates, academic year, and milestone period tracking properties.
files.businessPurpose: Represents a time block within the academic calendar used to structure duty hour tracking periods, rotation assignments, and milestone evaluations for each PGY level.
files.migrationNote: Academic calendar block structure is foundational to duty hours and evaluations. Block definitions need equivalent entity in Node.js.

files.summary: Business manager for rotation block calendar management, handling CRUD operations for department rotation blocks, milestone periods, academic year configuration, and default calendar setup.
files.businessPurpose: Manages the academic calendar block structure that defines duty hour tracking periods. Blocks divide the academic year into time periods for rotation scheduling, milestone assessments, and compliance reporting. Supports both standard rotation blocks and milestone-specific periods.
keyMethods: GetRotationBlocks - Returns rotation blocks filtered by PGY, academic year, and other criteria
Save - Saves a rotation block with start/end dates and academic year
SaveData - Saves block data with milestone group associations
GetMilestonePeriod - Returns milestone evaluation periods for a given filter
DeleteDeprtmentBlocks - Deletes blocks for a department by criteria
GetBlockPeriodForPGY - Returns the block period text for a specific PGY level
SaveDefaultStartDayForDutyHoursByDepartment - Sets the default weekly start day for duty hours
CheckDHRotationBlockCalendarMapWithSetup - Validates block calendar against setup configuration
GetResetRotationBlocks - Returns default rotation blocks for calendar reset
files.migrationNote: Block calendar management is fundamental to duty hours and evaluation scheduling. Academic year and block period logic needs careful migration to Node.js with timezone handling.

files.summary: Data transfer object for department clinic information with Amion/QGenda integration fields, schedule linking, and a Validate method for form validation.
files.businessPurpose: Represents a clinic location within a department's duty hour configuration, including external system mapping (Amion/QGenda), shift association, and scheduling integration properties.
keyMethods: Validate - Validates required clinic fields (ClinicName) and checks for name uniqueness based on page mode
files.migrationNote: DTO with validation; would map to a NestJS DTO with class-validator decorators.

files.summary: Business manager for department clinic CRUD operations with caching support, including listing, adding, updating, deleting, and disabling clinics within the duty hours system.
files.businessPurpose: Manages clinic locations that trainees can log duty hours against. Clinics are linked to activities and can be synced with external scheduling systems (Amion/QGenda). Implements in-memory caching for frequently accessed clinic lists.
keyMethods: GetDepartmentClinics - Returns cached clinic list for the department
GetDepartmentClinicsListByCriteria - Filtered clinic listing with search criteria
Save - Creates a new department clinic with Amion/QGenda mapping
Update - Updates an existing clinic record
Delete - Soft-deletes a clinic
SetClinicDisableFlag - Toggles clinic enabled/disabled state
DoesClinicNameExist - Checks for duplicate clinic names
files.migrationNote: Clinic management is part of the duty hours configuration. Caching pattern would use Redis in Node.js instead of in-memory cache.

files.summary: Simple search criteria DTO for filtering clinics by ID and name.
files.businessPurpose: Provides search/filter parameters for querying department clinics in listing views.
files.migrationNote: Simple filter DTO; would be query parameters in a NestJS controller.

files.summary: Enum defining the supported on-call scheduling service integrations: Disabled, Amion, Tangier, QGenda, Momentum, LightningBolt, and MECService.
files.businessPurpose: Provides a typed enumeration of all external on-call scheduling services that MyEvaluations can integrate with for importing rotation/call schedules.
files.migrationNote: Enum values need equivalent TypeScript enum or const object in the Node.js backend for schedule integration logic.

files.summary: Data transfer object for ACGME compliance rule settings including rotation-specific rule configuration, calculation rules, and excluded activity categories per PGY level.
files.businessPurpose: Represents department-level ACGME duty hour compliance settings that define which rules apply to which rotations and PGY levels, enabling customized compliance checking per program.
files.migrationNote: ACGME compliance settings are regulatory requirements that must be accurately migrated to Node.js.

files.summary: Business manager for ACGME compliance rule configuration, handling department-level compliance settings, ACGME rule management, global settings restoration, and category exclusion per PGY level.
files.businessPurpose: Manages the configuration of ACGME (Accreditation Council for Graduate Medical Education) duty hour compliance rules. Programs can customize which ACGME rules apply, set calculation methods, exclude certain activity categories from specific PGY levels, and restore settings to global defaults.
keyMethods: GetDepartmentComplianceSetting - Returns compliance settings for a rotation and academic year
GetDepartmentACGMERules - Returns ACGME rules configured for the department
RestoreGlobalComplianceSettings - Resets department settings to global defaults
CopyFromGlobalComplianceSettings - Copies global settings to department level
AddDepartmentComplianceSettings - Adds new compliance setting for a rotation
UpdateDepartmentComplianceSettingsCalculationRule - Updates calculation rule for a setting
AddDepartmentACGMERule - Adds or updates an ACGME rule
UpdateExcludedCategoryForPGY - Sets excluded activity categories for a PGY level
files.migrationNote: ACGME compliance configuration is a core regulatory feature. The compliance rules engine must be accurately replicated in Node.js with proper validation of all ACGME rule types.

files.summary: Large business logic class for conference management UI operations, including page initialization, question database management, evaluation report generation, conference document upload/update, and conference schedule importing with file parsing (CSV/Excel).
files.businessPurpose: Orchestrates the WebForms UI logic for the conference module, binding data to page controls, managing conference evaluations (individual and summary reports), handling document attachments via FileUploadComponentWebService, and implementing multi-step conference schedule importing from external files.
keyMethods: OnViewInitializeManageConferenceQuestionDatabase - Initializes the question management page for conference evaluations
OnViewInitializeIndividualConferenceEvaluationReport - Sets up individual conference evaluation report page
OnViewInitializeSummaryConferenceEvaluationReport - Sets up summary conference evaluation report page
SaveCoferenceDocumentDetails - Saves conference schedule with attached documents via file upload service
UpdateCoferenceDocumentDetails - Updates existing conference schedule with document management
ConferenceImporting - Multi-step CSV/Excel conference schedule import with field matching
ConferenceImportingStep2Initialization - Maps imported file columns to database fields
ConferenceImportingStep3Initialization - Validates mapped data before import
ConferenceImportingStep4Initialization - Executes final import of conference schedules
files.migrationNote: Conference management is a major feature. The UI-coupled business logic needs to be separated into API-level services in Node.js. File upload and importing logic need dedicated service classes.

files.summary: Contains multiple DTOs for conference evaluation templates: ConferenceEvaluationsTemplateInfo (template with questions), TemplateQuestionInfo (individual questions), ConferencePresenterinfo (presenter details), and ConferenceLearningObjectiveinfo (learning objectives).
files.businessPurpose: Provides data structures for conference evaluation forms, linking evaluation templates to their questions, presenters, and learning objectives for CME-accredited conferences.
files.migrationNote: Conference evaluation template DTOs need equivalent TypeScript interfaces. Multiple classes in one file should be separated in Node.js.

files.summary: Data transfer object for conference definitions implementing ICheckInSettings, containing conference name, type, frequency, evaluation template associations, check-in/geofence settings, and CME configuration.
files.businessPurpose: Represents a conference setup within a department, defining its schedule pattern, audience targeting, evaluation requirements, attendance tracking method (manual, QR, geofence), and CME credit configuration.
files.migrationNote: Conference configuration DTO with check-in settings interface. Needs equivalent TypeScript type with ICheckInSettings interface.

files.summary: Business manager for conference CRUD operations, conference template management, evaluation report generation, schedule integration with Amion/QGenda, and conference importing field mapping.
files.businessPurpose: Manages conference definitions including creation, updates, deletion, enable/disable, sharing between departments, template linking, audience configuration, and integration with external scheduling systems for conference-rotation associations.
keyMethods: GetConferenceList - Returns all conferences for the department
Save - Creates a new conference with audience, template, and schedule settings
Update - Updates an existing conference configuration
SetConferenceDeleteFlag - Soft-deletes a conference and returns affected schedule count
SetConferenceDisableFlag - Toggles conference enabled/disabled state
SetConferenceSharedFlag - Toggles conference sharing across departments
GetIndividualConferenceEvaluationResults - Generates individual conference evaluation report data
GetSummaryConferenceEvaluationResults - Generates summary conference evaluation report data
GetConferenceTemplatesAndPeriodByDepartmentConferenceID - Returns templates linked to a conference
files.migrationNote: Conference management is a core feature for GME programs. The CRUD operations, evaluation report generation, and scheduling integration all need equivalent Node.js services.

files.summary: Large data transfer object implementing ICheckInSettings for conference schedule instances, containing dates, times, presenters, attendees, evaluation data, attendance tracking, recurrence settings, document attachments, and CME credit tracking.
files.businessPurpose: Represents a specific scheduled instance of a conference, with all details needed for managing attendance, running evaluations, tracking CME credits, handling presenter assignments, and configuring check-in methods (manual, QR, geofence).
files.migrationNote: Complex DTO with many properties for conference schedule instances. Should be broken into smaller focused DTOs in Node.js.

files.summary: Major business manager for conference schedule operations including CRUD, attendance tracking (manual/QR/geofence), evaluation submission, presenter management, group/user lists, portfolio document linking, CME credit management, bulk operations, topic categories, and conference importing.
files.businessPurpose: Central manager for all conference schedule operations. Handles scheduling individual conference instances, managing attendees and presenters, processing check-in/check-out, running evaluations, managing recurrences, handling CME accreditation, and batch operations for conference administration.
keyMethods: GetConferenceScheduleList - Returns all scheduled conferences for the department
Save - Creates a new conference schedule instance with presenters and attendees
Update - Updates a conference schedule with attendance and presenter changes
UpdateUserAttendance - Records user attendance for a conference
UpdateUserAttendanceCheckInCheckOut - Records check-in/check-out times
EvaluateConference - Processes conference evaluation submissions
GetConferenceUsersAttendanceInfo - Returns attendance records by conference schedule
ConferenceImporting - Imports conference schedules from external data
SaveConferenceDocument - Links portfolio documents to conference schedules
UpdateBulkConferenceScheduleAttendanceStatus - Batch updates attendance status
files.migrationNote: Core conference scheduling engine with extensive stored procedure usage. Attendance tracking, evaluation processing, and CME credit management all need equivalent Node.js services. The bulk operations and importing logic are particularly complex.

files.summary: Search criteria DTO for filtering conference schedules by conference ID, date range, and conference name.
files.businessPurpose: Provides search/filter parameters for querying conference schedule listings in administrative views.
files.migrationNote: Simple filter DTO; would be query parameters in a NestJS controller.

files.summary: Search criteria DTO for filtering conferences by ID and name. Note: uses MyEvaluations.Business.Security namespace despite being in the DutyHours project.
files.businessPurpose: Provides search/filter parameters for querying conference listings. The Security namespace usage suggests this was possibly moved from another project.
files.migrationNote: Simple filter DTO with misplaced namespace.

files.summary: Constants class defining static duty hour configuration values and string constants used across the DutyHours module.
files.businessPurpose: Centralizes constant values (likely ACGME rule identifiers, category IDs, configuration keys) used throughout the duty hours business logic to avoid magic numbers and strings.
files.migrationNote: Constants should be migrated as a TypeScript constants file or enum in the Node.js backend.

files.summary: Data transfer object for department rotation verification settings, holding configuration for how rotation assignments are verified and approved.
files.businessPurpose: Represents the verification settings that control how duty hour rotation assignments are validated and confirmed within a department.
files.migrationNote: Simple DTO for verification settings; would be a TypeScript interface.

files.summary: Report manager for generating detailed conference tracking reports, including conference list retrieval, academic year lookup, and per-user conference attendance data aggregation.
files.businessPurpose: Generates detailed conference tracking reports that show individual trainee attendance records across conferences, including dates, times, and compliance with required conference attendance.
keyMethods: GetConferenceListByCriteria - Returns conferences filtered by search criteria for report selection
GetConferenceListForReports - Returns conference list for report dropdowns
GetCurrentAcademicYearStartDate - Returns the start date of the current academic year
GetDataForConferenceTrackingReport - Generates per-user conference tracking data
files.migrationNote: Report generation logic needs equivalent Node.js service. Report data could be served as API endpoints for React-based report rendering.

files.summary: Data transfer object for duty hour program-specific ACGME rules, including rule configuration, moonlighting settings, and program-level compliance overrides.
files.businessPurpose: Represents program-level duty hour rule configuration that allows individual residency programs to customize ACGME rule enforcement, including enabling/disabling moonlighting tracking.
files.migrationNote: Program-level rule configuration DTO; needs equivalent TypeScript type in Node.js.

files.summary: Business manager for program-level ACGME duty hour rules, handling program listings, rule CRUD, moonlighting configuration, and batch rule application across programs.
files.businessPurpose: Manages the application of ACGME duty hour rules at the individual residency program level. Allows programs to customize compliance rules, enable moonlighting tracking, and apply rules in bulk across criteria or specific programs.
keyMethods: GetProgramList - Returns programs available for duty hour rule configuration
GetProgramACGMERules - Returns ACGME rules configured for a program
IsMoonlightingEnable - Checks if moonlighting is enabled for a program
AddProgramACGMERule - Adds/updates an ACGME rule for a program
UpdateProgramMoonlighting - Updates moonlighting enabled/disabled status
ApplyProgramDHRulesByCriteria - Applies DH rules to programs matching criteria
ApplyProgramDutyHoursRules - Applies DH rules to specific programs
files.migrationNote: Program-level ACGME rule management is critical for compliance. The rule application logic must be accurately replicated in Node.js.

files.summary: Major report manager for generating all duty hour reports including detailed/summary compliance reports, completion status reports, institutional reports, record-of-rotations, schedule discrepancy reports, and BSN (nursing) reports. Also provides HTML report header/footer generation.
files.businessPurpose: Central reporting engine for the duty hours module. Generates compliance violation reports, completion tracking, institutional aggregate reports, rotation scheduling discrepancy reports, and nursing-specific BSN session reports. Includes HTML rendering helpers for server-side report generation.
keyMethods: GetDetailedComplainceReportData - Generates detailed ACGME compliance report with multiple overloads for different filter combinations
GetSummaryComplainceReportData - Generates summary compliance report with PGY, calculation type, and graph options
GetRecordOfRotationsReportData - Generates record-of-rotations report data
GetCompletionStatusReportData - Generates duty hour completion status report
GetInstitutionalComplainceReportData - Generates institution-wide compliance aggregate data
GetDetailedDutyHoursReportData - Generates detailed duty hours report with activity/rotation filters
GetDiscrepancyReportData - Generates schedule discrepancy reports
GetReportHeader - Generates HTML header with department logo
GetReportSubHeader - Generates HTML sub-header with filter info
files.migrationNote: All duty hour reports need equivalent API endpoints in Node.js. The HTML rendering helpers are not needed (React handles UI), but the data retrieval and business logic must be preserved. Compliance reports are critical for ACGME accreditation.

files.summary: The largest and most central manager in the DutyHours module. Handles user listing for duty hours, clinical hours import, schedule generation (iCal), duty hour verification/undo, department configuration, email notification management, PGY/trainee type utilities, on-call service configuration, and duty hour setup groups. Also defines helper classes for user/rotation report data.
files.businessPurpose: Central orchestrator for the entire duty hours system. Manages trainee user lists, clinical hours data import, personal schedule generation (iCal format), duty hour verification workflows, department-level DH configuration, email notification scheduling (violation alerts, non-submitter reminders), and integration with multiple external scheduling services (Amion, QGenda, Momentum, LightningBolt).
keyMethods: GetCurrentAcademicYear - Returns the current academic year for the department
GetAvailableUsersTableDH - Returns trainee users for duty hour operations
ImportClinicalHours - Imports clinical hours data from external systems
GenerateMySchedule - Generates personal rotation schedule data
GenerateMyScheduleForIcal - Generates iCal format schedule for calendar integration
GetDutyHourVerificationUsers - Returns users pending duty hour verification
UndoDutyHourVerifiedUsers - Undoes verification for selected users
GetDHDepartmentsForEmail - Returns departments configured for DH email notifications
UpdateDutyHourSetupConfiguraion - Updates department-level DH configuration
GetPGYTextforDepartment - Returns PGY level display text for the department
GetUsersListByGroup - Returns users by duty hour group membership
files.migrationNote: This is the single most important class in the DutyHours module and must be migrated with extreme care. It contains foundational methods used by virtually every other DH class. The schedule generation, verification workflow, email notification logic, and external system integration all need equivalent NestJS services.

files.summary: Data transfer object for duty hour setup group configuration, defining user groups for duty hour tracking within a department.
files.businessPurpose: Represents groups of users configured for duty hour tracking, allowing departments to organize trainees into groups for reporting and management purposes.
files.migrationNote: Simple DTO for group configuration.

files.summary: Data transfer object for duty hour exception records, capturing special circumstances or overrides in duty hour tracking.
files.businessPurpose: Represents exception entries that override normal duty hour rules for specific situations (e.g., approved extensions, special circumstances).
files.migrationNote: Simple DTO for exception tracking.

files.summary: Business manager for exporting duty hour data, providing a single method to retrieve duty hours data formatted for export.
files.businessPurpose: Handles the extraction of duty hour data for external export/download, used for institutional reporting and data sharing.
keyMethods: ExportDutyHours - Retrieves duty hour data formatted for export based on date range and user criteria
files.migrationNote: Export functionality needs equivalent API endpoint in Node.js returning CSV/Excel data.

files.summary: Data transfer object for duty hour export parameters and result data.
files.businessPurpose: Holds export configuration and result data for the duty hours export functionality.
files.migrationNote: Simple export DTO.

files.summary: Thin wrapper for the FileUploadComponent web service, providing file upload functionality for duty hours related documents.
files.businessPurpose: Provides file upload capabilities for conference documents, schedule imports, and other duty hour related file attachments via the shared FileUploadComponent web service.
files.migrationNote: File upload would use Azure Blob Storage or similar in the Node.js backend instead of a SOAP web service.

files.summary: Filter criteria DTO for rotation block queries, containing PGY number, academic year, block number, delete/schedule/configure flags.
files.businessPurpose: Provides filtering parameters for querying rotation blocks used in duty hour calendar and schedule management.
files.migrationNote: Simple filter DTO; would be query parameters in a NestJS controller.

files.summary: Data transfer object for geofence location definitions, containing name, address, coordinates (latitude/longitude), and radius for location-based attendance tracking.
files.businessPurpose: Represents a named geofence zone configured for a department, used to verify trainee physical presence at clinical locations via mobile device GPS for automated attendance tracking.
files.migrationNote: Geofence data structure needs equivalent TypeScript type. GPS-based attendance is a mobile feature relevant to the MAUI app.

files.summary: Business manager for geofence location CRUD operations, including listing, adding, updating, deleting, and status management of department geofence zones.
files.businessPurpose: Manages GPS-based geofence locations used for automated attendance tracking. Departments define geofence zones around clinical sites, and trainees' mobile devices check GPS coordinates against these zones for conference/duty check-in.
keyMethods: GetDepartmentGeofenceNames - Returns geofence locations for the department
AddDepartmentGeofenceNames - Creates a new geofence zone with coordinates
UpdateDepartmentGeofenceNames - Updates geofence location details
SetDepartmentGeofenceStatus - Enables/disables a geofence zone
DeleteDepartmentGeofenceName - Deletes a geofence zone
GetGeofenceNamesInfoByID - Returns details for a specific geofence
GetDepartmentAddress - Returns the department's primary address for geofence setup
files.migrationNote: Geofence management needs equivalent Node.js service. GPS coordinate handling and radius calculations should be done server-side.

files.summary: Data transfer object for conference/duty hour group participant data, including group name, user assignments, and user type filtering.
files.businessPurpose: Represents a participant group used to organize users for conference attendance tracking and duty hour management within a department.
files.migrationNote: Simple DTO for group membership.

files.summary: Business manager for managing participant groups used in conference attendance and duty hour tracking, including CRUD operations, group copying, and user type filtering.
files.businessPurpose: Manages the creation and membership of user groups used for conference attendance tracking and duty hour management. Supports copying groups, filtering by user type, and restoring deleted groups.
keyMethods: GetGroupParticipantsListByCriteriaForAllUsers - Returns groups with participant lists filtered by criteria
UpdateGroupParticipantsInfo - Updates group name and participant assignments
DeleteGroupParticipantsInfo - Deletes a participant group
AddGroupParticipants - Creates a new participant group with member assignments
CopyGroupparticipants - Copies an existing group with a new name
DoesGroupNameExist - Checks for duplicate group names
files.migrationNote: Group management needs equivalent Node.js service. Group membership could leverage existing RBAC/group features in the Node.js backend.

files.summary: Search criteria DTO for filtering participant group listings.
files.businessPurpose: Provides filter parameters for querying participant groups in administrative views.
files.migrationNote: Simple filter DTO.

files.summary: Data transfer object for guest conference presenter information, storing name, email, and degree for external speakers not in the MyEvaluations system.
files.businessPurpose: Represents an external guest presenter at a conference who is not a registered MyEvaluations user, capturing their basic contact and credential information.
files.migrationNote: Simple DTO for guest presenters.

files.summary: Business manager for guest presenter CRUD operations within conference schedules, handling adding, updating, and retrieving external speaker information.
files.businessPurpose: Manages external guest presenters for conferences, allowing departments to track speakers who are not in the MyEvaluations user system.
keyMethods: AddGuestPresenters - Adds a new guest presenter to a conference
UpdateGuestPresenters - Updates guest presenter details
GetConferenceGuestInfoByID - Retrieves guest info for a conference
files.migrationNote: Simple guest management; would be part of the conference service in Node.js.

files.summary: Report manager for generating institutional-level detailed clinical hours reports, providing department, PGY, and user lookups along with aggregate report data.
files.businessPurpose: Generates institution-wide detailed clinical hours reports that aggregate duty hour data across multiple departments and programs for institutional oversight and ACGME compliance reporting.
keyMethods: GetDetails - Returns department/program details for report selection
GetGetPGYs - Returns PGY levels across selected departments
GetReport - Returns the institutional detailed clinical hours report data
files.migrationNote: Institutional-level report needs equivalent API endpoint in Node.js.

files.summary: Report manager for generating monthly conference reports, including conference schedule data retrieval, presenter information aggregation, and date-specific report data.
files.businessPurpose: Generates monthly conference activity reports showing conference schedules, presenter assignments, and attendance summaries for a given month, used for department administration and CME tracking.
keyMethods: GetDataForMonthlyConferenceReport - Returns monthly conference report data
GetConferencePresentersInfoWithComma - Returns presenter names formatted with commas
GetMonthlyConferenceScheduleReportDataForDate - Returns conference data for a specific date
files.migrationNote: Monthly report generation needs equivalent API endpoint returning structured data for React rendering.

files.summary: Standard .NET assembly information file with version metadata for the MyEvaluations.Business.DutyHours assembly.
files.businessPurpose: Assembly metadata - no business logic.
files.migrationNote: Not applicable - .NET assembly metadata.

files.summary: Auto-generated settings designer class for the DutyHours assembly, managing web service URLs and configuration settings.
files.businessPurpose: Provides typed access to application settings including web service endpoint URLs for file upload and other service integrations.
files.migrationNote: Auto-generated settings; Node.js uses environment variables instead.

files.summary: Contains multiple DTOs for QGenda scheduling system integration: QGendaInfo (schedule data), TaskTags (task metadata), and Tags (tag definitions).
files.businessPurpose: Data structures for integrating with the QGenda physician scheduling platform, mapping QGenda tasks, roles, and tags to MyEvaluations duty hour activities and rotations.
files.migrationNote: QGenda integration DTOs need equivalent TypeScript interfaces for the API-based integration in Node.js.

files.summary: Stub/empty file for Record of Rotation report manager. Report logic appears to be implemented in DutyHourReportManager instead.
files.businessPurpose: Placeholder for record-of-rotations report generation; actual implementation is in DutyHourReportManager.GetRecordOfRotationsReportData.
files.migrationNote: Empty stub file; no migration needed.

files.summary: Large data transfer object containing extensive report input/output properties for duty hours reporting, including date ranges, PGY filters, user selections, compliance flags, rotation filters, and BSN nursing-specific fields.
files.businessPurpose: Comprehensive DTO that carries all report parameters and result fields for the duty hours reporting system, supporting multiple report types (compliance, completion, detailed, summary, BSN, institutional).
files.migrationNote: Large reporting DTO should be broken into report-type-specific DTOs in Node.js to improve maintainability.

files.summary: Manager for retrieving and importing on-call schedule data from the Amion scheduling system via web service calls, parsing XML responses, and saving imported schedules to the database.
files.businessPurpose: Handles the automated import of on-call schedule data from the Amion (Amion.com) scheduling system. Connects to the Amion Staffing web service, retrieves staff assignments, parses the data, and writes it to the MyEvaluations database for duty hour tracking.
keyMethods: RetrieveSchedules - Main entry point for Amion schedule import
SearchAmionSchedule - Searches Amion web service for schedule data by criteria
AddAmionScheduleByDepartmentID - Saves imported Amion schedule data to the database
files.migrationNote: Amion web service integration needs equivalent HTTP client-based service in Node.js. The XML parsing and schedule import logic are critical for institutions using Amion.

files.summary: Manager for retrieving and importing schedule data from QGenda, LightningBolt, and Momentum scheduling systems via REST API calls, handling authentication, JSON parsing, and database persistence.
files.businessPurpose: Handles automated import of schedule data from multiple external scheduling platforms (QGenda, LightningBolt, Momentum). Connects to vendor APIs, authenticates, retrieves schedule assignments, maps them to MyEvaluations rotations/users, and persists the data for duty hour tracking.
keyMethods: RetrieveQGendaSchedules - Main entry point for QGenda schedule import
ImportLightningBoltData - Imports schedules from LightningBolt platform
ImportLightningBoltPersonalData - Imports personal schedules from LightningBolt
ImportMomentumData - Imports schedules from Momentum scheduling system
AddQgendaScheduleByDepartmentID - Saves imported QGenda schedule data
files.migrationNote: Multi-vendor schedule integration needs equivalent REST client services in Node.js. API authentication, rate limiting, and error handling patterns must be preserved. This is a critical integration point for many institutions.

files.summary: Business manager for reviewing geofence-based attendance history, providing methods to retrieve GPS check-in/check-out records and location entry/exit details.
files.businessPurpose: Allows administrators to review the geofence attendance history for trainees, showing when and where they entered/exited geofenced clinical locations, supporting verification of duty hour attendance claims.
keyMethods: GetgeofenceHistory - Returns geofence attendance history for the department
GetUsergeofenceHistory - Returns geofence history for a specific user
GetEntriedExitLocDetails - Returns entry/exit location details with timestamps
files.migrationNote: Geofence history review needs equivalent API endpoint in Node.js.

files.summary: Data transfer object for rotation-specific duty hour settings, containing activity category linked hours, prepopulated hours, and per-rotation duty hour configuration.
files.businessPurpose: Represents the duty hour configuration for a specific rotation, defining which activity categories apply and what hours should be prepopulated when trainees are assigned to that rotation.
files.migrationNote: Rotation DH configuration DTO needs equivalent TypeScript type.

files.summary: Data transfer object for department rotation definitions, containing rotation name, abbreviation, campus, linked activities, on-call service mapping, disable/delete flags, and verification settings.
files.businessPurpose: Represents a clinical rotation within a department's training program, with all configuration for duty hour tracking, on-call schedule linking, campus assignment, and administrative management.
files.migrationNote: Core rotation DTO used throughout the system. Needs equivalent MikroORM entity or TypeScript interface.

files.summary: Business manager for rotation CRUD operations, including rotation listing with campus/year/type filters, saving/updating rotations with duty hour activity linking, rotation settings management, verification configuration, and rotation activity associations.
files.businessPurpose: Manages clinical rotation definitions for residency programs. Rotations are fundamental to the duty hours and evaluations systems, linking trainees to clinical experiences and defining which duty hour activities, compliance rules, and evaluations apply.
keyMethods: GetDepartmentRotations - Returns rotations for the department with optional campus/year/shift filters
GetDepartmentRotationsForScheduleManagement - Returns rotations optimized for schedule management views
Save - Creates a new rotation with linked activities and compliance settings
SaveRotationDutyHours - Saves duty hour activity associations for a rotation
Update - Updates rotation details and linked activities
Delete - Soft-deletes a rotation
RestoreRotations - Restores a deleted rotation
SetRotationDisableFlag - Toggles rotation enabled/disabled state
SaveDepartmentRotationVerificationSettings - Saves verification configuration for a rotation
GetRotationDetails - Returns full rotation details including settings and activities
files.migrationNote: Rotation management is foundational to both duty hours and evaluations. The rotation CRUD, activity linking, and verification settings all need equivalent NestJS services.

files.summary: Data transfer object for schedule import job history, tracking the status and timing of automated schedule synchronization jobs.
files.businessPurpose: Records the history of automated schedule import jobs from external systems (Amion, QGenda), used for monitoring sync status and troubleshooting import issues.
files.migrationNote: Job history DTO; would be a BullMQ job result type in Node.js.

files.summary: Report manager for generating summary conference tracking reports with multiple report variants, including presenter tracking, calculation-based summaries, and tabular data formats.
files.businessPurpose: Generates summary conference attendance reports that aggregate trainee participation across conferences for a department or institution, supporting ACGME conference attendance compliance reporting.
keyMethods: GetConferenceListByCriteria - Returns conferences for report selection
GetConferences - Returns all conferences for the department
GetDataForSummaryConferenceTrackingReport - Generates summary attendance data
GetDataForSummaryConferencePresentersTrackingReport - Generates presenter participation summary
GetSummaryConferenceReportCalculationData - Returns calculated attendance percentages
GetTableDataForSummaryConferenceTrackingReport - Returns tabular format data for export
files.migrationNote: Conference tracking reports need equivalent API endpoints. The multiple report variants suggest a flexible report configuration system in Node.js.

files.summary: Data transfer object for Amion-to-MyEvaluations clinic synchronization mapping, containing sync ID, external clinic name, matched MyEvaluations clinic, and CRUD flags.
files.businessPurpose: Represents a clinic mapping between Amion/QGenda external scheduling systems and MyEvaluations department clinics, used during the sync configuration process.
files.migrationNote: Sync mapping DTO for external system integration.

files.summary: Business manager for clinic synchronization between external scheduling systems (Amion, QGenda) and MyEvaluations, handling matched/unmatched clinic lists, adding/removing clinic mappings, and offline clinic data retrieval.
files.businessPurpose: Manages the mapping between clinics in external scheduling systems and MyEvaluations department clinics. Administrators manually match external clinics to internal ones, enabling automated schedule import.
keyMethods: GetSyncAmionClinics - Returns Amion clinics with their MyEvaluations mapping status
GetSyncQGendaClinics - Returns QGenda clinics with mapping status
Save - Saves matched/deleted clinic mappings
GetOnCallClinicsOffline - Returns offline-cached Amion clinic data
GetQGendaClinicsOffline - Returns offline-cached QGenda clinic data
files.migrationNote: Clinic sync management needs equivalent Node.js service for external system integration.

files.summary: Data transfer object for Amion/QGenda on-call activity synchronization mapping, including sync ID, external activity names, matched MyEvaluations activities, and academic year.
files.businessPurpose: Represents an on-call activity mapping between external scheduling systems and MyEvaluations activities, enabling automated import of on-call schedules.
files.migrationNote: Sync mapping DTO for on-call integration.

files.summary: Business manager for on-call activity synchronization between external scheduling systems (Amion, QGenda, Tangier) and MyEvaluations, handling activity matching, on-call service configuration, and offline data caching.
files.businessPurpose: Manages the mapping between on-call activities in external scheduling systems and MyEvaluations activities. Also provides department-level on-call service configuration, Tangier location lookups, and service label customization.
keyMethods: GetMyEvalActivities - Returns MyEvaluations activities for the on-call category
GetSyncAmionCallServices - Returns Amion call services with mapping status
GetSyncQGendaCallServices - Returns QGenda call services with mapping status
Save - Saves matched/deleted on-call activity mappings
GetTangierLocationSites - Returns Tangier location data
GetDepartmentOnCallServiceID - Returns the configured on-call service for the department
GetOnCallServiceName - Returns the display name of the configured on-call service
GetLastUpdatedDatesForSchedules - Returns sync timestamps
files.migrationNote: On-call service integration is critical. The multi-vendor support (Amion, QGenda, Tangier, Momentum, LightningBolt) needs equivalent service in Node.js.

files.summary: Data transfer object for Amion/QGenda rotation synchronization mapping, containing sync ID, external rotation names, matched MyEvaluations rotations, academic year, and on-call service type.
files.businessPurpose: Represents a rotation mapping between external scheduling systems and MyEvaluations department rotations, enabling automated schedule import at the rotation level.
files.migrationNote: Sync mapping DTO for rotation integration.

files.summary: Business manager for rotation synchronization between external scheduling systems (Amion, QGenda, Tangier) and MyEvaluations, handling rotation matching, offline data caching, Tangier web service calls, and XML deserialization.
files.businessPurpose: Manages the mapping between rotations in external scheduling systems and MyEvaluations department rotations. Handles Tangier SOAP web service calls for location data, Amion/QGenda rotation matching, and batch rotation sync operations.
keyMethods: GetMyEvalRotations - Returns MyEvaluations rotations for sync matching
GetSyncAmionRotations - Returns Amion rotations with mapping status
GetSyncQgendaRotations - Returns QGenda rotations with mapping status
Save - Saves matched/deleted rotation mappings
GetTangierLocationResponse - Calls Tangier SOAP web service for location data
TangierLoactionDeserialize - Deserializes Tangier XML response
GetTangierRotations - Returns rotations from Tangier system
files.migrationNote: Rotation sync with multiple vendors needs equivalent Node.js service. Tangier SOAP integration should be converted to REST if possible.

files.summary: Data transfer object for Amion/QGenda user synchronization mapping, containing sync ID, external user names, matched MyEvaluations users, academic year, and staff type.
files.businessPurpose: Represents a user mapping between external scheduling systems and MyEvaluations user accounts, enabling automated schedule import to correctly assign schedules to the right trainees.
files.migrationNote: Sync mapping DTO for user integration.

files.summary: Business manager for user synchronization between external scheduling systems (Amion, QGenda) and MyEvaluations, handling user matching, auto-sync, offline data caching, and manual sync override for unmatched users.
files.businessPurpose: Manages the mapping between users in external scheduling systems and MyEvaluations user accounts. Supports automatic name-based matching, manual override for unmatched users, and offline data caching for systems with intermittent connectivity.
keyMethods: GetMyEvalUsers - Returns MyEvaluations users for sync matching
GetSyncAmionUsers - Returns Amion users with mapping status
Save - Saves matched/deleted user mappings
GetDataUserToSyncOffline - Returns offline Amion user data
GetQgendaDataUsersToSyncOffline - Returns offline QGenda user data
GetAutoSyncDataUsersToSyncManuallyTestOffline - Returns auto-synced users that need manual verification
GetOnCallUsers - Returns on-call users from the external system
files.migrationNote: User sync management is critical for schedule integration. The auto-sync and manual override patterns need equivalent Node.js logic.

files.summary: Data transfer object for duty hour violation explanation entries, containing the explanation text, department ID, and a Validate method for required field checking.
files.businessPurpose: Represents a predefined explanation that administrators can select when reviewing ACGME duty hour violations, providing standardized reasons for compliance exceptions.
keyMethods: Validate - Validates that the explanation text is not empty
files.migrationNote: Simple DTO with validation; NestJS DTO with class-validator.

files.summary: Business manager for violation explanation CRUD operations with caching, including listing, adding, updating, deleting, and uniqueness checking of predefined violation explanations.
files.businessPurpose: Manages the library of predefined violation explanations that administrators use when reviewing ACGME duty hour violations. Implements caching for frequently accessed explanation lists.
keyMethods: GetViolationExplanation - Returns cached violation explanations for a department
FetchViolationExplanationInfo - Returns a specific explanation by ID
DoesViolationExplanationExist - Checks for duplicate explanations
Save - Creates a new violation explanation
Update - Updates an existing explanation
Delete - Deletes a violation explanation
files.migrationNote: Violation explanation management needs equivalent Node.js service. Caching should use Redis.

files.summary: Data transfer object for duty hour violation review records, containing violation details (user, timesheet, dates, rule, status), reviewer information, and explanation associations.
files.businessPurpose: Represents an ACGME duty hour violation that requires administrative review, including the violated rule, affected time period, trainee information, and resolution status.
files.migrationNote: Violation review DTO needs equivalent TypeScript type for the compliance review workflow.

files.summary: Business manager for ACGME duty hour violation review workflow, including violation listing with pagination, single/bulk violation updates, violation detail retrieval, violation count for dashboard badges, admin verification, and settings-change-triggered violation recalculation.
files.businessPurpose: Central manager for the violation review process. When duty hour submissions violate ACGME rules, violations are flagged for administrator review. This manager handles listing, reviewing, resolving, and tracking these violations, including badge counts for pending reviews.
keyMethods: GetVoilationList - Returns paginated list of violations with filters and sorting
UpdateViolatoin - Updates a single violation review status with explanation
UpdateViolatoins - Bulk updates violation statuses
GetViolationDetailsByID - Returns full details for a specific violation
GetDutyHoursViolationToReviewCount - Returns count of pending violations for dashboard badges
IsCheckDutyHoursAdminUserDepartmets - Checks if user is a DH admin for any department
SaveUserViolationByAdmin - Recalculates violations after compliance settings change
IsDutyHoursAdminUserExist - Checks if any DH admin exists for the department
files.migrationNote: Violation review is a critical compliance workflow. The review process, violation counting, and settings-change recalculation all need accurate Node.js implementation.

files.summary: Auto-generated WCF service reference for the Momentum Staffing web service, containing data contracts for staff, roles, and assignments used in on-call schedule integration.
files.businessPurpose: Generated proxy client for the Momentum/MedHub Staffing web service, providing typed access to staff scheduling data for import into MyEvaluations duty hours. Contains JSON-prefixed data contracts (JSONStaff, JSONRole, JSONAssignment).
files.migrationNote: WCF service reference would be replaced by REST API client (Axios/fetch) in Node.js.

files.summary: Auto-generated SOAP web service proxy for the FileUploadComponent service, providing file upload, download, cropping, and deletion operations.
files.businessPurpose: Generated proxy client for the file upload web service used to manage conference documents, schedule import files, and other duty hour related attachments.
files.migrationNote: SOAP file upload service would be replaced by Azure Blob Storage SDK or multer-based upload in Node.js.

files.summary: Duplicate/versioned SOAP web service proxy for the FileUploadComponent service (version 2), generated from an older runtime version.
files.businessPurpose: Secondary version of the file upload web service proxy, likely created for backward compatibility or different service endpoint configuration.
files.migrationNote: Duplicate service reference; consolidate in Node.js migration.

files.summary: Auto-generated SOAP web service proxy for the Tangier Locations service, providing location maintenance operations for the Tangier scheduling integration.
files.businessPurpose: Generated proxy client for the Tangier scheduling system's location web service, used to retrieve and maintain location/site data for on-call schedule integration.
files.migrationNote: SOAP proxy for Tangier locations; would be replaced by REST client if Tangier still used.

directoryOverview: The Business.DutyHours module manages ACGME-compliant duty hour tracking for medical residency programs. It encompasses clinical activity management, rotation/block calendar configuration, ACGME compliance rule enforcement, conference management with attendance tracking (manual/QR/geofence), violation review workflows, multi-vendor schedule integration (Amion, QGenda, Tangier, Momentum, LightningBolt), and comprehensive reporting (compliance, completion, conference tracking, institutional). The module is heavily used by 900+ institutions and contains critical regulatory compliance logic.
keyWorkflows: Activity Management: CRUD operations for duty hour activities organized by categories (clinical, on-call, educational), with QR code-based attendance scanning
Rotation & Block Calendar: Academic year block period configuration, rotation definitions with linked activities, PGY-level settings, and campus/site management
ACGME Compliance: Rule configuration at department and program levels, compliance calculation, violation detection, and violation review with explanation workflow

Conference Management: Conference CRUD, schedule instances, attendance tracking (manual/QR/geofence), CME credit management, presenter/guest management, evaluation integration, and conference importing from CSV/Excel

External Schedule Sync: Multi-vendor integration (Amion, QGenda, Tangier, Momentum, LightningBolt) for importing on-call schedules, mapping external entities (users, rotations, clinics, activities) to MyEvaluations records

Reporting: Detailed/summary compliance reports, completion status, conference tracking (detailed/summary/monthly), institutional aggregate reports, record-of-rotations, schedule discrepancy, and BSN nursing reports
Duty Hour Verification: Verification workflow for submitted hours, batch verification/undo, admin approval process
Email Notifications: Violation alerts, non-submitter reminders, personal violation notifications to trainees and administrators
